bibl.title: Statues of Ptolemaic Queens from Alexandria, Canopus and Heracleion-Thonis.

series.title: Oxford Centre for Maritime Archaeology. Monograph

bibl.note: Contribution to the conference: The Trade and Topography of Egypt's North-West Delta, 8th century BC to 8th century AD, Berlin, 2006. - 1. The colossal queen from Heracleion-Thonis. - 2. The queen with the Isis garment from Heracleion-Thonis. - 3. The queen from East Canopus.

bibl.title: Alexandria and the North-Western Delta. Joint Conference Proceedings of Alexandria: City and Harbour (Oxford 2004) and The Trade and Topography of Egypt's North-West Delta, 8th century BC to 8th century AD (Berlin 2006)

bibl.seg: Albersmeier Sabine, Statues of Ptolemaic Queens from Alexandria, Canopus and Heracleion-Thonis.

Damian Robinson and Andrew Wilson (Edd.), Alexandria and the North-Western Delta. Joint Conference Proceedings of Alexandria: City and Harbour (Oxford 2004) and The Trade and Topography of Egypt's North-West Delta, 8th century BC to 8th century AD (Berlin 2006) = Oxford Centre for Maritime Archaeology. Monograph 5 (Oxford, 2010) pp. 191-201, 10 figg. coul.

Contribution to the conference: The Trade and Topography of Egypt's North-West Delta, 8th century BC to 8th century AD, Berlin, 2006. - 1. The colossal queen from Heracleion-Thonis. - 2. The queen with the Isis garment from Heracleion-Thonis. - 3. The queen from East Canopus.
